news_header: Finland signed the NASA Artemis Treaty, committing to sustainable space practices, despite China and Russia not being signatories.
news_text: Finland has become the 53rd signatory of the NASA Artemis Treaty, which aims to establish common rules for sustainable activities in space, including the Moon and Mars. The treaty, led by the United States, has not been signed by China or Russia. Business Minister Wille Rydman signed the agreement in Espoo, emphasizing Finland's commitment to the Western community in space exploration. The treaty promotes peace, cooperation, and transparency, while also addressing space debris and safety zones. The Ministry of Employment and the Economy believes this will benefit Finnish researchers and companies in the Artemis project.
